div.l: A wake Symond the feend is on me falle
Myn herte is brokyn I am but ded
There lith on on my wombe ⁊and on my hed
Help Symkyn for þe fals clerkis fiȝte
This Iohn stert vp as faste as he myȝte
And graspid be the wallis to and fro
To fynde A staf and she stert vp also
And knew þe estis bet þan did þis Iohn
And bi the wall a staf she took Anon̄
And saw A litil shymerynge of a liȝt
For at an hole yn shon the mone liȝt
And bi þat liȝt she shaw ham bothe two
But sikirli she nyste who was who
And as she saw A whit þing in her ye
An whenne she gan this white þing A spie
She wende the clerk hadde werid a volupier
And with þe staf he drew ay nere and nere
And wende haue hit þis Aleyn at þe full
And smoot þe myller on the pilid skull
And doun he goth ⁊and cride harow I dye
The clerkis bette him wel and let hym lye
And greiden ham and eek hir hors anon̄
And eke hir mele and on her wey þey goon̄
And atte mylle dore ȝit he took his cake
Of half a busshel flour wel I bake
Thus is þe proud myller wel I bete
And hath lost þe gryndynge of þe whete
And paid for þe soꝑper everidell
Of Aleyn and of Iohn þat beet him wel
His wif is swyvid and his douȝter Als
Lo such it is a Millere to be fals
And þerto this proverbe is said ful soth
Him dare not wene well þat evil doth
A gilour shal him self agilid be
And god þat sit in high mageste
